<p style="color: white; text-align: center; padding: 20px; font-size: 18px;"><b>Cutting Corners?</b><br>Here I celebrate the 25th anniversary of Arthur Lupia's 1994 seminal article, Shorctus Versus Encyclopedias, by revisiting its central themes. Using the author's original data, I identify and explore two complications in the validity of his "knowledge" variable. These complications have major implications on how we interpret Lupia's findings.</p></div>
